info.name: Early Partial Delivery of Embargoed Reports

request.description:
Very first query, to request the authentication token (valid 24 hours).

Pre-requisites:
1) Install the DSS REST Postman environment.
2) Set the "dss-user" and "dss-password" environment variables to a valid DSS account.
3) Set the environment variable "user" to the same value as "dss-user", but without the double quotes.

To run subsequent requests:
1) Copy the received token value into the "authorization" environment variable.

The body of the request contains the field list, instrument list and conditions.

This request might return data, or timeout (which could be due to an embargo).

If there was a timeout:
1) The response status will be 202 (Accepted), and the body will not contain data. Instead, the response header will contain a "Location" URL.
2) Copy that URL into environment variable "locationUrl", and then run the next request Tuto-3c, to retrieve the data from that URL.

Note: if the timeout was due to an embargo, the data will only be available at the end of the embargo delay.

Typical embargo durations during trading hours range from 15 minutes to 1 hour; some specific instruments have longer delays, up to 24 hours.

Request data using the job ID.

Pre-requisites:
1) Run Tuto-14a (and probably 14b) to get the "JobId".
2) Copy the value of the "JobId" from the response body into the "jobId" environment variable.

Request data using the job ID.

Pre-requisites:
1) Run Tuto-14a (and probably 14b) to get the "JobId".
2) Copy the value of the "JobId" from the response body into the "jobId" environment variable.

The body of the request contains the instrument list name, which must be unique.

If a list with the same name already exists, this call will fail.

If the call succeeded, a ListId is returned.

=> Copy that ListId into environment variable "listId".

item.name: 4.2: Append instrumemts to an instrument list

request.description:
The listId returned by the previous call is passed as a parameter in the URL.

The body of the request contains the instruments to add.

Pre-requisites:
1) Run Tuto-8b: Create an empty instrument list.
2) Copy the value of the "ListId" from the response into the "listId" environment variable.

item.name: 4.3: Create an intraday pricing report template

request.description:
The body of the request contains, among other parameters, the report template name, which must be unique.

If a report template with the same name already exists, this call will fail.

If the call succeeded, a ReportTemplateId is returned.

=> Copy that ReportTemplateId into environment variable "reportTemplateId".

The body of the request contains, among other parameters, the listId and reportTemplateId that were returned by the previous calls.

It also contains the schedule name, which must be unique.
If a schedule with the same name already exists, this call will fail.

If the call succeeded, a ScheduleId is returned.

=> Copy that ScheduleId into environment variable "scheduleId".

Pre-requisites:
1) Run the previous steps.
2) Emsure you have copied the values of the "ListId" and ReportTemplateId from the previous responses into the corresponding environment variables.

item.name: 5.1: Get a report extraction from the pending extraction

request.description:
The schedule Id, which was returned by the previous call, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Do not proceed further, wait and repeat this call until the returned Status is "Completed".

=> Copy the value of the returned ReportExtractionId into environment variable "reportExtractionId".

item.name: 5.2: Get a report extraction from the completed extraction

request.description:
The schedule Id, which was returned by the previous call, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Do not proceed further, wait and repeat this call until the returned Status is "Completed".

=> Copy the value of the returned ReportExtractionId into environment variable "reportExtractionId".

The schedule Id, which was returned by the previous call, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Do not proceed further, wait and repeat this call until the returned Status is "Completed".

=> Copy the value of the returned ReportExtractionId into environment variable "reportExtractionId".

The schedule Id, which was returned by the previous call, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Do not proceed further, wait and repeat this call until the returned Status is "Completed".

=> Copy the value of the returned ReportExtractionId into environment variable "reportExtractionId".

The schedule Id, which was returned by the previous call, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Do not proceed further, wait and repeat this call until the returned Status is "Completed".

=> Copy the value of the returned ReportExtractionId into environment variable "reportExtractionId".

The schedule Id, which was returned by the previous call, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Do not proceed further, wait and repeat this call until the returned Status is "Completed".

=> Copy the value of the returned ReportExtractionId into environment variable "reportExtractionId".

This is to cleanup.

The schedule Id, which was returned by the Tuto-8e call that scheduled the extraction, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

This is to cleanup.

The report template Id, which was returned by the Tuto-8d call that created the report template, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

This is to cleanup.

The instrument list Id, which was returned by the Tuto-8b call that created the instrument list, is passed as a parameter in the URL.

Request data using the job ID.

Pre-requisites:
1) Run Tuto-14a (and probably 14b) to get the "JobId".
2) Copy the value of the "JobId" from the response body into the "jobId" environment variable.
